text:
Despu√©s de probar incontables marcas, he llegado a la conclusi√≥n de que la arena para gatos perfecta no existe. Sin embargo, esta de Arm & Hammer se acerca bastante a lo que necesito para mi hogar con tres gatos, ofreciendo un muy buen balance entre sus puntos fuertes y sus debilidades.

Su mayor virtud es, sin duda, el control de olores. Siempre y cuando se realice una limpieza diaria del arenero, encapsula los olores de manera muy eficaz. El aroma que tiene la arena en s√≠ es agradable y fresco, pero no tan invasivo como para molestar a los gatos o a las personas.

En cuanto al aglutinamiento, que es donde muchas arenas fallan, esta cumple de forma aceptable. Los terrones de orina no son los m√°s compactos del mercado y a veces pueden deshacerse un poco al recogerlos o pegarse en el fondo de la caja si no hay suficiente profundidad de arena. No es un gran problema, pero es un punto a tener en cuenta.

El rendimiento es otro punto a su favor. Para dar una referencia clara, una caja me dura aproximadamente un mes para mis tres gatos, lo cual me parece una excelente relaci√≥n entre calidad y precio.

text:
I used to love this litter ‚Äî it had a nice cedarwood scent, clumped tightly, and kept odors under control even with two cats in a small apartment. But something has clearly changed in the last few months. The new formula smells different (and not in a good way), the clay feels heavier and cheaper, and there‚Äôs a lot more dust.

Odor control just isn‚Äôt what it used to be. I find myself doing a full litter change within 5 days because the urine smell becomes overwhelming. The clumping ability has also gone downhill ‚Äî it falls apart way too easily now.

On top of that, it tracks everywhere. I‚Äôm vacuuming and sweeping constantly because my cats leave little trails of litter all over the place.

To make matters worse, Amazon sometimes ships it through USPS, which means I have to drive several miles to the post office to pick it up ‚Äî kind of defeats the point of home delivery.

Really disappointing because this used to be my go-to litter. Until they fix whatever they changed, I‚Äôll be switching brands.

text:
I've used Arm & Hammer cat litter for years--its never been the cheapest, but its always been the only clay cat litter that is nearly dust free, or it was. The Arm & Hammer Forever Fresh Clumping Cat Litter Cedarwood, MultiCat, Pet Friendly with Essential Oils, version of Arm & Hammer cat litter have essential oil BUT it certainly does not have enough of the oils, or anything else for that matter, to control the dust. When I dumped this litter into the litter box, from about 1 foot above the litter box, there was so much dust that I had to stop 4 times just to let the dust clear.

Even worse, it was very easy to tell when my cats had used the litter box because they came out covered in dust. I might be able to wear a mask when I dump the litter, but the poor little kitties don't do so well with masks.

On the plus side, the litter did a great job at controlling odors. However, after 3-weeks when it was time to dump the litter....the litter now infused with all the stuff my cats left behind, the dust was HORRIBLE.

text: I ordered this a few times last year and loved it, then stopped ordering it when it doubled or tripled in price for a while. Around boxing day, it dropped to less than it originally was, so I was excited to pick it up again. The litter is not the same! This litter smells like baking soda, not like cedar. It used to strongly smell of cedar and was very good quality litter. The litter I got with my recent order came in the same box, but barely any cedar smell if any, and also the litter itself seems chunkier and not as good quality as it used to be. Not sure what's going on there.
